AgeInfo: Older than 1105.15 $\pm$ 0.33 Ma Osler_R2 pole, perhaps similar in age in Logan Sills ($^{\mathrm{207}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb date of 1109 $\pm$ 1 Ma)

PmagRef: Halls, 1974; Swanson-Hysell et al., 2014b; this study
AgeInfo: $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U date of 1105.15 $\pm$ 0.33 Ma for a rhyolite at Agate Point (this study)
Likely older than ca. 1105 Ma given distinct higher latitude pole position from Osler R1 and similar position to ca. 1107 Ma Siemens Creek Volcanic Pole
Older than $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U date of 1100.4 Ma based on stratigraphic position; likely ca. 1105 Ma based on comparison with paleomagnetic data from the Osler Volcanic Group

PoleName: Mamainse lower normal and upper reversed
PolarityZone: Flour Bay normal and reversed polarity zones
AgeInfo: Age constrained by $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U date of 1100.36 $\pm$ 0.25 Ma on Flour Bay tuff
Likely ca. 1094 Ma based on similar pole position to the Portage Lake Polarity Zone North Shore Volcanic Group poles
Close to, but slightly older than, $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U 1105.60 $\pm$ 0.32 Ma based on date from Red Rock Rhyolite

PoleName: North Shore Volcanic Group (upper NE sequence)
AgeInfo: Younger than the $^{\mathrm{207}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb 1097.7 $\pm$ 1.7 Ma date from the Big Bay Rhyolite, the Devil's Kettle Rhyolite ($^{\mathrm{207}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb date of 1097.7 $\pm$ 2.2) Ma is within sequence, older than the $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U 1091.61 $\pm$ 0.14 Ma date within the Beaver Bay Complex
AgeRef: Davis and Green, 1997; Fairchild et al., 2017

PoleName: North Shore Volcanic Group (upper SW sequence)
AgeInfo: $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U dates on 40th Ave. Icelandite (1096.62 $\pm$ 0.31) and Lakewood Icelandite (1095.82 $\pm$ 0.29) provide lower bounds and the Palisade Rhyolite (1094.2 $\pm$ 0.2) provides an upper bound

PmagRef: Books, 1972; Tauxe and Kodama, 2009; Fairchild et al., 2017
AgeInfo: $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U date of of 1091.48 $\pm$ 0.21 Ma on Beaver Bay Complex aplite provides maximum age constraint
$^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U dates on Copper City flow 1093.36 $\pm$ 0.53 Ma and Greenstone Flow 1091.67 $\pm$ 0.29 Ma provide a lower and upper bound
Younger than Greenstone Flow, $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U date on Lake Shore Trap andesitic flow of 1085.47 $\pm$ 0.32 Ma
Older than the $^{\mathrm{207}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb date of 1107.3 $\pm$ 1.6 Ma from a rhyolite in the Kallander Creek Volcanics

PmagRef: Palmer and Davis, 1987); Fairchild et al. (2017)
AgeInfo: $^{\mathrm{206}}$Pb/$^{\mathrm{238}}$U dates on the West Sand Bay tuff 1084.39 $\pm$ 0.21 Ma and the Davieux Island Rhyolite 1083.52 $\pm$ 0.23 Ma bracket the VGPs
Likely younger than Michipicoten Island Formation. Deposited prior to eruption of Bear Lake Volcanics in lower Freda Sandstone

PmagRef: Palmer and Davis (1987); Fairchild et al. (2017)
AgeInfo: Data come from lowermost Freda Formation. Interbedded Bear Lake Volcanics suggest that not too much younger than youngest rift volcanism
